item.description: Representation of finite groups The reference includes [steinberg2012] Chapter 1-6. Representation of finite groups A representation of a group \(G\) is homomorphism \(\phi: G \to GL(V)\) for some (finite-dimensional) vector space \(V\). The dimension of \(V\) is called the degree of \(\phi\). equivalence; G-invariant subspace; irreducible representation; completely reducible representation; indecomposable representation; unitary representation Completely decomposition Proposition Every representation of a finite group is equivalent to a unitary representation.
